intro: Phebalium laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth phebalium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are usually white or cream, with a distinctive yellow center, blooming in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
